text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Today I’m here
with my sister Mo! Mo: Hey everybody!

Ro: And, Hasbro sent us two Easy Bake Ovens,
this is so cool!

Ro: And I thought we gotta do something cool,
so today we are gonna be
Ro: doing the Easy Bake Oven Challenge!

Ro: The Easy Bake Oven Challenge is something
that Mo and I made up for fun.

Ro: So today we are gonna be assembling these
recipes for points.

Ro: We are gonna be assembling the Red Velvet
Strawberry Cake, the
Ro: Pretzels, because Mo loves Pretzels!

Mo: Pretzels and hot dogs are probably two
of my favorite foods!

Mo: So I’m really jacked about these! I’ll
probably eat yours also!

Ro: Huh! Oh my gosh I’ll have to fight her
off with these! Mo: You probably will!

Ro: And last but not least, I picked out the
Chocolate Truffles, because
Ro: I love chocolate!

Ro: The Easy Bake Oven challenge is gonna
be very easy! Ah-ah-ah-ah!

Mo: It might be easy for me though, I used
to have one as a kid and I

Mo: used to use it all of the time, so, I
have a little bit of experience

Mo: with the oven. Ro: Mo does have an advantage,
but I have a lot of
Ro: experience decorating. Mo: That's true. Ro: So, it’s a tossup!

Ro: We have 2 of each recipe, and whoever
does a better job of assembling
Ro: their treat will get a point.

Ro: May the best Easy Baker win! Mo: Put ‘er
there!
Ro: Molly!
Mo: OK, which one do you want to do first?
Ro: Oh Molly! How could I ever choose?

Ro: Chocolate Truffles! Mo: Chocolate Truffles!
Ro: Yeah!

Ro: Uh oh Molly, it says you have to be 8+.
Mo: I made it!

Ro: To make these. Mo: I can make ‘em! Can
you make them? Ro: I don’t know!
Mo: We have frosting. Ro: Pfft! Pfft!

Ro: First step is to plug in your Easy Bake
Oven, check, and turn it on,

Ro: it has to preheat for 20 minutes. Turn
it on.

Mo: To make the batter, pour 1 devils food
cake mix and 5 teaspoons of water

Mo: into a bowl, break up any lumps and stir
until smooth!
Ro: Into a bowl, get in there, get in there!

Ro: OK, 5 teaspoons. Mo: Don’t spill! Ro:
Gotta make ‘em perfect!
Ro: Gotta make ‘em….
Ro: Ohh, yes!
Ro: They’re, oh no I lost count!

Mo: I’m really gonna put some elbow grease
in here! Errrrr!

Mo: Have you ever heard that? Ro: No! Mo:
Elbow grease, you know, it’s like really

Mo: getting in there and using your muscles.
Ro: Grease?
Mo: Yeah. Ro: From your elbow?

Ro: Step 3, lightly spray the baking pan with
cooking spray.

Ro: Step 4, spoon the batter into the baking
pan, spread evenly, tip…

Ro: if the batter is too thick, add a few
drops of water and stir.

Mo: This is kinda thick, I wonder if I should
add water.
Ro: I don’t know, I like thick truffles!

Ro: I’m like kinda sad that I didn’t have
an Easy Bake growing up.

Mo: What did you play with a lot growing up?
Ro: I can’t remember!
Ro: My invisible friend.
Ro: I made my mom make sandwiches for him.
Ro: Here we go.
Mo: Alright, 16 minutes, here we go!

Ro: We’re pushing it into the cooling chamber,
and we’re gonna let it sit

Ro: there until it’s completely cooled,
then we’ll take it out.

Ro: Alright, now we’re gonna take him out.
Oh that’s cool!
Mo: Oh, there we go, there we go!
Ro: Look at that!
Mo: Now it’s time to make the frosting.
Mo: Make sure to get all that, oh!

Ro: It’s a good thing I’m not wearing
white pants today!

Ro: It’s OK, that’s a… New style now!
Mo: Ohhh!
Ro: Mmhmm, that’s done!

Mo: Crumble your cake in a separate bowl and
add half of the frosting.
Ro: Oh I should take my rings off oopsies!

Ro: Molly did you take your rings off? Mo:
I just did. Ro: I still got one.

Mo: Oh my gosh! How many rings you got on
those little fingers?

Ro: I got bling bling bling! Mo: Oh my gosh!
Ffft-ffft-ffft!

Mo: I can’t, I can’t… Ro: Whoa, whoa
what are you doing over there?

Mo: My hair’s in my face. Ro: Pfft! Let
me help you. Mo: That’s not helping!
Mo: What if we just made one BIG truffle?
Ro: Best day ever! That’s what would happen!

Ro: Now for my favorite part, time to decorate.
We're gonna take the remaining frosting

Ro: and spread it on the outside of our little
balls and now we are gonna
Ro: cover them with teeny, round sprinkles.

Both: Ta-da! Ro: Here are the chocolate Truffles
that we made.

Ro: Over here, these beauties are mine. Mo:
And these are mine.

Ro: I was looking at the picture on the box,
and the truffle is completely

Ro: covered with sprinkles, so I am gonna
give Mo the point because
Ro: hers have more sprinkles.

Mo: A point over here! Ro: Ding! A point for
Mo! Onto the next treat!

Mo: And the next treat we’re gonna make
are some Red Velvet and Strawberry

Mo: Cakes. Ro: Pour 1 red velvet cake mix
and 4 teaspoons of water into

Ro: a bowl and stir until smooth, just like
last time.

Ro: Molly are you using your elbow grease?
Mo: Oh that grease is in there!

Ro: Time to bake, we’re gonna bake for 16
minutes, just like before.

Ro: Now we’re gonna make the strawberry
cakes the same way.

Ro: Now we’re gonna remove them, they’ve
completely cooled and I’m holding

Ro: Cookie over here. Mo: She’s gonna eat,
try to eat it right when it comes out!
Ro: This is difficult to bake and have a dog!
Both: Ah-ahhhh!
Mo: Oh she’s getting close, AH! Ro: Oh no!

Ro: Cookie says, uh, what’s next is make
the frosting.

Ro: Oh, the double mix! Is this what DJs feel
like?

Ro: Now we’re gonna stack our cakes to make
it look like the picture, so

Ro: we’re gonna start with the pink cake
on the bottom, and then add our

Ro: pink frosting. Now you’re gonna take
your red velvet cake, stack it

Ro: on top. Take your knife and you can cut
it into sections, I’m gonna cut
Ro: it into 8. Frost the top, here we go!
Ro: Now time to decorate!

Ro: Aw! Now according to the picture they
stick straight up like that.
Both: Ta-da! Ro: Red Velvet Strawberry Cakes!

Ro: Over here we’ve got my little cakes.
Mo: And we have mine over here.

Mo: I think I’m gonna have to give the point
to you on this one, I think

Mo: you got more points for presentation.
Ro: 1 to 1, tie game!
Ro: Onto the next treat!

Mo: And it all comes down to the pretzels, who’s
gonna win this challenge!

Mo: This is a big deal. Ro: Winner takes all,
right here. Mo: This is a big deal!
Mo: OK! Ro: Alright, whats the first step?

Ro: Pour 1 egg wash mix, 2 tablespoons of
water into a bowl, and stir.

Ro: Now we’re gonna set these aside and
make our pretzel dough.

Mo: You get 1 pretzel mix and 4 teaspoons
of water. And then you stir and

Mo: press the mixture together until you form
the dough.

Mo: Big decisions! We need to decide if we
want to roll them out and make
Mo: little pretzels, or if we just want pretzel sticks.
Ro: I want to make little Pretzels! Mo: OK!

Ro: OK, make 6 little balls, and then we roll
them. Mo: Into ropes.

Mo: Lift them up, oh you twist in the middle! Oh! 
Look it’s a little pretzel!

Mo: Oh my gosh, these are adorable! Ro: These
are really cute!

Ro: Now use a pastry brush or your finger
to spread the glaze on top of

Ro: the dough, then sprinkle a little bit
of the coarse salt.

Ro: Oh my gosh! I love it! Mo: Oh you’re
going for it!

Ro: Now it’s time to bake! We’re gonna
put it in the oven and bake it

Ro: for 12 minutes! Mo: Alright! Ro: Oh yeah,
oh yeah!

Ro: Now we’re gonna let them cool, and while
they're cooling we’re gonna

Ro: make the nacho cheese. This part is totally
optional, but, why not?!?

Mo: We’re gonna pour the nacho cheese and
2 tablespoons of water into the bowl
Mo: and stir it up!

Both: Ta-da! Ro: Here are all the little pretzels that
we made!
Ro: Over here we have my very salty pretzels!

Mo: And over here are my pretzels! Ro: They
are adorable!

Ro: Mo, I gotta hand it to you, those are
really well made, like you know

Ro: how to twist a pretzel! Mo: Oh my gosh,
that was so fun, I’ve never

Mo: made pretzels before, and it was really
fun to learn how to twist them and make them.

Ro: Hmmmm, has she never made them before?
Or does Mo sneak out of the house
Ro: at night and moonlight as a pretzel maker?
Ro: Bbb-bbb-bbb, bbb-bbb-bbb-bbb-bbb!

Ro: Congratulations to Mo! The victor of the
Easy Bake Oven Challenge!
Mo: Oh thank you, thank you very much sister!
Ro: Nice job sister, nice job sister!

Ro: Our final score was two to one, so it
was close, but, Mo just

Ro: pulled ahead with those pretzels, they’re
so adorable!

Ro: I just wanted to say a big thank you to
my sister Mo for playing this

Ro: game with me today! Mo: Aw! Ro: And, a
big thank you to Hasbro for

Ro: sending us these awesome Easy Bake Ovens,
it was so nice.

Ro: Thank you so much for sponsoring this
and making this happen.

Ro: Huh, Mo! Which one was your favorite one to
make today?
Both: Pretzels!
Mo: Oh yes! Ro: Oh, jinx-jinx-jinx-jinx-jinx!

Mo: Yeah, that was so much fun because I’d
never made pretzels before.
Ro: Me too! Mo: So, I learned something new!
Ro: Cheers! Mo: Cheers! Ro: Cheers!
Mo: Mmm! Ro: Mmmmmmmm!
Ro: Om-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!
Mo: Hmmm-hmm-hmmmm! Hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm-hmm!
